inn1.comm: length ball, a bit of swing in towards off stump. Guptill gets on the front foot to defend
back of a length now, angled in and cramping the batsman for room. A bit of bounce too, and he gets on his toes to defend it
back of a length on off stump, blocked off the back foot into the covers
a bit wider outside off this time and Guptill shoulders arms
angled in again, towards middle stump this time, and he tucks it away towards midwicket
fullish, angling in towards off stump. McCullum defends from the crease, back to the bowler
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
short and wide and that was asking to be hit. Guptill slaps it firmly but can't beat point
fuller, fairly wide outside off, left alone. Swung away after passing the batsman

shot! That was a decent enough delivery, back of a length on a fourth-stump line, and he simply played a short-arm checked pull to beat the man at midwicket. A cross between a flick and a pull, with front leg off the ground
full outside off, left alone
length ball, fairly close to off stump. Guptill leaves it alone
length ball, not too wide outside off. McCullum sits on the back foot and slaps it to point
back of a length, angling in a touch too far, and McCullum whips it off his hips past the short fine leg
short and wide, cut away to the man at deep point
length ball outside off. Guptill presses forward and blocks into the off side
nice length, a bit of movement in towards off and middle. Guptill pokes it into the covers
too straight, and Guptill gratefully flicks it in the air, to the right of the man at short midwicket

down the track comes McCullum, and that's an ugly swipe. Tried to take this ball from outside off and smash it over midwicket, but it hit the toe end and rolled away into the leg side, squarer than he would have liked
on the charge again, and this time Perera bowls it a touch wider. McCullum frees his arms and flat-bats it over the bowler and it bounds away to the long-off boundary
slower ball, a touch short, and McCullum pulls it away to deep backward square leg
slower ball again, short again. McCullum has to wait a while before it comes on and he drags the pull out to deep midwicket
back of a length, tucked off the hips to deep midwicket
another short slower ball, another pull to deep midwicket
good ball, angling in and attacking the top of off stump. McCullum comes forward to defend into the covers
width now and McCullum stands up and carves it over cover. Doesn't quite middle it as well as he would have liked, and it stops short of the rope
better line now, on off stump. McCullum punches to short cover
stays back to a length ball on off stump, slightly inside the line, and opens his bat face to steer it to deep point
full now, just outside off. Guptill comes forward to defend into the off side
length ball on middle and off. Guptill defends with the angle, to short midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket
another loopy delivery on a straight line. Defended towards mid-on
short this time, and just enough width for McCullum to rock back quickly and slap it away to the cover boundary
back to fuller and straighter. McCullum defends towards mid-on
on the pads now and it's tucked away to the left of the man at short fine leg
tossed up nice and slow and Guptill drives it firmly back down the ground, hits the stumps at the other end
looks to cramp McCullum for room, overdoes the angle, slants it down the leg side
slower ball on off stump. McCullum stays on the back foot, chops it down towards short cover
back of a length on middle stump. McCullum stays next to the line and dabs it towards short third man
back of a length on off stump, punched down the ground towards mid-on

gone! The shot seemed to be on, full and wide, and Guptill tried to launch it over mid-off. Didn't make the connection he wanted, didn't get the elevation he wanted, and he hit it straight to the fielder
full, angled across Latham, and he lets it go through to the keeper
back of a length now, and he goes back and across to block towards mid-off
back of a length on off stump. McCullum goes back and flat-bats it down to long-on
tossed up nice and slow on off stump. Defended off the front foot towards mid-on
more loop, and he gets forward to block it back to the bowler
down the pitch now and he clips it to mid-on, who's too deep in the circle to save the single
slow and loopy on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
length ball on off stump. McCullum makes a bit of room and steers it to point
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length, tucked off the hips towards deep backward square leg
length ball on off stump. McCullum pushes it to mid-off and immediately calls his partner through for the single
full on off stump, a tiny bit of swing in, and he plays a checked drive to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-off
lovely. That was tossed up again, on off stump, and he simply got inside the line and lofted it over the bowler, bounces down to the long-off boundary
looked to repeat the shot but Senanayake bowled it slower and he ended up slicing it towards the cover boundary, didn't quite middle it
quicker now, worked into the on side off the front foot
a bit of air again, and he clears his front leg and swings it over the leg side, one bounce and over the rope at deep midwicket
slow again, and this time he goes deep in the crease and punches it towards short midwicket
goes on the back foot again, to a ball that is fairly full, and opens up his body to enable the punch down the ground for the single to long-on
flighted and full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
goes back to a full ball on off stump and hurriedly brings his bat down to defend
a bit of width now, and he slaps it away to deep point
tossed up, swept from outside off down to deep backward square leg
shortish ball, and he's back in a flash to pull it away to the midwicket boundary
fuller now, angled in towards middle stump, defended off the back foot, back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, steered off the back foot to point
back of a length again, straighter now, and he works it away through midwicket
down the track comes McCullum and Perera offers up a shortish ball. He skipped away nimbly to make a bit of room, and flat-batted it extremely hard through extra cover
low full-toss on off stump, smacked very hard but straight to short cover
short ball, and those will just sit up on this pitch. Makes himself room again and carves it, up and over, to the cover boundary. Brings up his half-century off just 39 balls
slower ball, full this time, and McCullum sends this disappearing over the wide long-off boundary, coming forward and staying leg-side of the ball to make himself some swinging room
tossed up full on middle stump, and he clips it away through midwicket
tossed up, angled in towards off stump, and he presses forward to defend into the on side
slower still, nice and full, and he defends it back to the bowler
quicker now, fired in towards leg stump, and he goes back to defend towards short midwicket
on the same leg-stump line, a little slower, and he has a bit more time to go back and work it into the square leg region
gone! That was fired across very quick, back of a length. Latham looked to cut, it was too close to him, and he ended up nicking to the keeper
quickish on leg stump and he goes back and tucks it away carefully into the leg side
angled in towards leg stump again and he gets forward to defend
short, and McCullum is immediately in position to pull it away over the midwicket boundary
quickish on leg stump and he works it away towards square leg
full and quick on leg stump, pushed into the on side
looks to angle it in and ends up slipping it down the leg side
length ball on middle and leg. McCullum goes back and punches it towards midwicket
tossed up full on middle and leg, and he clips it down to long-on to get off the mark
full and quick on leg stump, clipped towards backward square leg
looks to make room to drive inside-out, but Herath bowls this quick and angles it in, and he can only hit it straight back towards the bowler
back of a length now and he punches it down to long-on
loopy delivery on middle and leg, clipped towards short midwicket
tossed up outside off and he comes forward and plays a checked drive, with an open bat face, towards deep point
tossed up on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
drops onto a good length on middle stump, and he blocks it back to the bowler
a bit of loop again, defended into the off side
a bit of flight again, clipped from off stump down to long-on
a bit quicker now, nice stump-to-stump line, punched firmly back to the bowler
short ball, and that is an incredible shot from McCullum. Simply leans back and swats it over the fielder at long-on
full and quick on middle and leg, clipped towards short fine leg
a bit of air now, driven down to long-off
full and quick on leg stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
full, angling in towards off stump, defended into the covers
full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length on off stump. McCullum makes room for the big slap through the off side, can't beat short cover
tossed up outside off, driven to cover
tossed up again, and he can't beat short cover with that push-drive
looks to sweep a low full-toss down the leg side, misses connecting with it
back of a length, goes with the angle towards off stump, punched towards cover point
back of a length on leg stump, worked towards midwicket
fuller now, and it turns away and beats the bat as he tries to steer it towards point

angled in towards off stump and they take off for a single after that forward defensive push trickles towards square leg. Throw went to the keeper's end, which was a mistake because McCullum was the man to call and he was quickly through
tossed up outside off, McCullum welcomes the room and lofts it over the man at short cover
quicker now, defended to short cover
again a bit of width, this time he has to reach for the drive and it goes to the sweeper at deep cover point
quick and full, angling in towards off stump, and he presses forward to block into the off side
dangled up slow outside off, driven to short cover
back of a length, quick, angling in. McCullum is cramped for room and he defends into the covers
a bit slower and he goes for the big slog over the top. Doesn't connect cleanly, bounces down to long-on
quicker now, and Taylor plays a shovel-drive down to long-on
full outside off, driven to the left of long-off
full on leg stump, clipped to mid-on
quickish on off stump, and he dabs it to the left of Dilshan at short cover, and the batsmen run a quick single
full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
slower now, nice dip and it turns towards off stump. Taylor lets it come on and defends towards point
straighter now, and he comes forward and works it into the on side
quick and fairly full, on middle and off. McCullum goes on the back foot and punches it to long-on
tossed up, angling in towards off stump. Taylor comes forward, looking for the dabbed single into the covers, plays it too close to the short cover fielder
quicker now, and he's hurried into a defensive push back to the bowler
sees some flight and skips down the track, launches it down the ground, over the long-off boundary
back of a length, leg-stump, and he goes back and works it towards short fine leg
quicker, on off stump, and McCullum comes forward to defend
a touch short outside off and he slaps it away to sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, no real turn, and he comes forward to defend
a little fuller now, defended towards short cover
length ball, angling down leg, and he tucks it away to the right of the man at backward square leg
tossed up outside off, defended to short cover
full, almost in the blockhole on middle and leg, blocked to mid-on
quick and full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
full on leg stump, driven to wide mid-on/straight midwicket
stays back to a fairly full ball on middle stump, punches it down to long-on
fielded! That was full on leg stump and McCullum wanted to drive inside-out to long-off. Mendis flew to his left and stopped it
full and quick on off stump, defended into the offside
back of a length now, punched to sweeper cover
quickish on off stump and he stretches out to lap it towards short fine leg
sees a bit of flight and comes down the track, and Mendis gets it to dip on him and force him to defend
a touch short and he skips back nimbly to cut it away to the left of the sweeper
angles it towards leg stump and Taylor brings out that lap-sweep again to use the angle, and use the pace to split the keeper and the man at short fine leg
on the pads now and he tucks it away towards deep square leg
tossed up on middle stump. McCullum looked to swipe this over midwicket, I think, and ended up dragging it along the ground through square leg
flighted on middle stump, driven to straight midwicket
nice loop again, outside off this time, and he defends into the covers
length ball outside off, and Taylor plays it cannily late, chopping down on it to place it wide of short third man
quick, down the leg side. McCullum can't middle the sweep, gets a bottom-edge on it, and it bounces off the pads of the unsighted Sangakkara
shorter now, cut to point
fuller, straighter, clipped to straight midwicket
tossed up down the leg side, gets a decent amount of bat on the sweep and Sangakkara manages to stop it with his left foot
sweeps again, can't beat short fine leg
quick and full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
on the pads, clipped away towards square leg

down the track, and in the effort to make room he got a little too far from the ball, an attempted wide yorker. He reached out and got a thick outside edge that Sanga, diving to his right, got a bit of glove to
another wide yorker, left alone. Juuuust inside the line
and that's the century! It's full and wide again and he throws his bat at it and gets an edge that neatly bisects the keeper and short third man
boom. Runs out of his crease now and finally Perera bowls that back-of-a-length, hit me ball outside off that he flat-bats in the air, between the bowler and mid-off

Oh, oh my. That is poor from Sri Lanka. They have missed a golden chance to run McCullum out. Taylor clipped it straight to short fine leg, and sent back McCullum who had hared out of his crease. Thirimanne's throw to the bowler was too wide, and he couldn't quite collect it cleanly and hit the stumps even though McCullum was a long way out of his crease
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up on middle and off, clipped to long-on
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
reverse-sweep now. It's full, angling away from him, and he uses the pace and angle with a little controlled dink to the third man boundary
tossed up on leg and middle, beats Taylor in the air. He looked to work it leg side and got a leading edge to short cover
a bit of air again. This time he waits for it to land and opens his bat face to steer the drive to the man at sweeper cover
goes for the sweep but it's a touch too quick for him, slides on with the angle and hits him on the thigh pad
fullish on leg stump, and he swipes it over the leg side, down to deep midwicket
there's that lap sweep again, a single down to short fine leg to bring up 150
fuller, quicker, driven down to long-on
down the track, Senanayake has given this some air, and McCullum gives it even more air, launching it cleanly over the short straight boundary at long-on, clatters into the sightscreen on the full
nicely flighted length ball outside off, and he stretches out to defend
length ball again, and he makes room to cut towards point. Hit it from in front of middle stump
goes back to a fairly full ball, punches it down to long on
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up on off and middle, clipped to short midwicket

got him! No 200 for McCullum. It was nicely tossed up on off stump, and it wasn't as full as McCullum thought. He checked his drive, and popped it back to Mendis, who took a good low return catch tumbling to his left
and he starts with a four. It was a touch short, and it slid on with the angle and gave him width outside off. He simply chopped down on it and sent it racing away to the third man boundary
short again and he gets down on one knee to pull it to deep midwicket
tossed up, turns from middle to off, and Taylor defends watchfully into the covers
nice flight, lands on a nice length again on off stump, and he blocks it back to the bowler
a bit quicker and straighter and he plays a punchy drive past the bowler, down to long-on
full on middle stump, clipped down to long-on. Was in the air for a bit but Dilshan couldn't get to it, diving to his right
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
flat, angled across towards off stump. Taylor jumps back and across to defend
fuller now, on leg stump, nurdled away through midwicket
full on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
looked to make room but he bowled it quick and full, and he can only defend to short cover

that was amazing anticipation from Sangakkara, saw Taylor shaping to play the lap-sweep and moved quickly to his left. Got his pads in the way of the ball, but couldn't get his hands down to complete the rebound catch
looks for the sweep again from outside leg, can't connect
now Vettori goes for the sweep and misses. Loud appeal for lbw but it struck him outside the line of off stump
another sweep, this time he does well to connect, because it was right in front of middle stump, and it goes rolling down to deep backward square leg
full on leg stump, clipped to square leg
a bit of air outside off and he plays a checked drive down to long-off, past the diving bowler

lbw appeal, not given, Sri Lanka have reviewed. Vettori went for the reverse-sweep there. It pitched on middle and definitely straightened... may have brushed the sleeve of his forearm before hitting his pad. Certainly no glove. It's pitching on middle and hitting middle, according to Hawkeye. But the impact is more than 3m down the pitch, and that means the umpire's decision stands! Not out! Mahela has a chat with the umpire and he's absolutely livid.
length ball on middle stump, defended back to the bowler

He's gone now, Vettori is walking. Taylor goes back to a length ball going across him and works it into the leg side. They go for the single despite the fact that it was hit almost straight to the fielder at short midwicket. Sangakkara did very well to collect Mendis' throw and disturb the bails in one smooth motion, and Vettori knew he was out even though the square leg umpire went upstairs. He was a good couple of yards outside the crease.
full on leg stump, clipped to deep backward square leg
full on off stump and he drives it back to the bowler

is that another run-out? Not quite. It's on the pads and he clipped it to short midwicket again. Sent back Anderson who hared out of his crease, and Mendis' throw to the bowler's end was low and flat, and it only just missed the stumps. Dilshan collected and hit the stumps again, quickly, but the bails didn't quite come off
down the leg side, worked away towards short fine leg
shortish and wide, he tried to cut but can only get a bottom edge that rolls through to the keeper
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, not wide enough to cut, and he chops it away backward of point
slower ball, full on off stump, and he comes forward to defend into the covers
length ball on middle and leg, and Anderson, feet rooted to the crease, gets an inside-edge onto his pads as he tries to defend
shortish, pulled down to deep backward square leg. He didn't have much room to free his arms there
length ball on off stump. Anderson goes on the back foot to defend
a touch shorter and he has a bit more time to punch this down to long-on
down the leg side now and Taylor gets his second boundary, with the same shot that got him his first boundary, the lap sweep between the keeper and short fine leg
length ball on middle stump, clipped through square leg
quickish length ball on middle and off, goes back and blocks it back to the bowler
and again, similar delivery, this time he goes a little deeper in his crease and pushes it down to long on
full on off stump, driven down to long-on
saw Taylor shuffling across towards off stump and fired it down the leg side. He seemed to miss the sweep but it wasn't given wide. Maybe he got a thin edge and Sanga dropped it...

...but that doesn't matter. Herath gets him next ball. He goes for the sweep again, is hurried into the shot by the pace of the ball, and top-edges it high in the air, and Perera settles under it comfortably at short fine leg
back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Anderson goes back and dabs it to backward point

Another run-out. What's happening here, New Zealand? It's on the pads, and he tucks it towards short midwicket and sets off. It was straight to Dilshan, and Ronchi - who didn't look like he wanted to run the single but responded to his partner's call anyway - is beaten quite easily by the throw, right over the bails, leaving Sanga an easy job of completing the dismissal
full on off stump and he shuffles across to clip it towards midwicket
tossed up, turns towards off stump as he goes back to the length ball. Punched to short cover
back of a length, a bit quicker and straighter, blocked back to the bowler
on the pads now and he works it away towards short fine leg
full on middle and leg, clipped to straight midwicket
length ball on off stump, slides on with the angle. He looks to push that down the ground, goes off the inside half of the bat to that straight midwicket fielder

Another! This is disastrous from New Zealand. Great work from Mathews at straight midwicket, dives to his right to intercept that back foot punch from Anderson, who set off for the single, thinking he had beaten the fielder. He was stranded halfway down the pitch when Mathews threw to Sangakkara, who had enough time to grab a little snack before taking the bails off if he so wished.
loopy delivery, angled across towards off stump. Looks to work it leg side and gets a leading edge that pops towards mid-off
back of a length now, worked off the hips to short fine leg
short ball, pulled straight to deep midwicket
loopy on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
good ball, goes with the angle towards off stump, and Milne doesn't know too much about it, manages to squirt it away towards short third man
airy and full on middle stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
goes back to a length ball on middle stump, works it to short midwicket
fuller now, outside off, driven down to mid-off, who's on the edge of the circle
quickish length ball on off stump, pushed to mid-off for another single
a touch shorter, Milne goes back to defend to short extra cover
full and quick on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
on the pads now, nurdled away to deep backward square leg
tossed up on off stump and he gets on the front foot to squeeze it away to the right of point
back of a length, barely comes on as he goes back to cut, too close to him too, and he pokes it out to short cover
fuller now, blocked back to the bowler
full outside off, a bit slower, he has to reach for it and he drives with a lot of bottom hand back to the bowler
back of a length, no room to cut or punch, and he ends up pushing it to mid-off
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
down the track now, whipped away to deep midwicket
shuffles across and is outside off stump when Dilshan delivers. Can only clip this full, straight ball straight to short midwicket
shot. This one stayed in the air a little longer, and was wide enough for McCullum to pull out the reverse-sweep and find the third man boundary
down the track and he fires it into the pads, clipped straight to short fine leg
full on leg stump again, whipped away to the right of deep backward square leg
full and straight, flicked away to the right of deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full, angled in towards middle and leg, and he tumbles in his follow-through to palm a firm straight drive to short extra cover, and cut off the single
shuffles across, and he bowls it quick and flat on off stump. Defended towards short cover
back of a length on off stump, cuts but can't beat point
sees him making room and bowls it full on leg stump. Defended back to the bowler
full on leg stump again. He makes room to drive inside-out, can't beat the man at short extra cover
full and quick, driven firmly back to the bowler
down the leg side, can't beat short fine leg with the sweep
quick and flat on off and middle, clipped to straight midwicket
down the track now, flicked away to deep midwicket, and there's the New Zealand 200
sees the loop on this ball and skips nimbly down the track, uses his bottom hand to good effect to shovel it over mid-off
full on middle and leg, clipped to straight midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards middle and off. Milne defends off the back foot, into the off side
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler

what a shot that is! It's not quite driving length, on off stump, and Milne hits that on the up between short cover and mid-off, who got a hand on it diving to his left to slow it down and prevent the four. Well done, Mahela

and that is number four. It's back of a length on off stump, and he punches it down the ground to mid-off and decides to take on Mahela's arm. Big mistake. Low, flat direct hit and McCullum is nowhere near his crease
short ball, and Milne pulls it away towards deep square leg
full outside off, defended to short cover
down the track, Dilshan bowls it full and straight, and he can only pat it back towards the bowler
down the track again, this time he manages to whip it down to long-on
full on the pads, clipped down to long-on
short ball, Milne can't time that pull and it rolls away towards short fine leg
tossed up outside off, pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, and he clips it to long-on, beating Dilshan, who dives to his right and gets into a bit of a tangle with the non-striker's legs
length ball outside off. Henry looks to punch that through cover and gets a thick edge down to third man
low full-toss on off stump, and he looks to punch that hard down the ground but it hits the bottom of his bat and bounces down to mid-on
full outside off, driven towards deep point
full and wide again and this time he plays the cover drive, well timed. The sweeper has to run across quite a long way to his right to cut it off on the slide
bouncer, and he hooks it down to deep backward square leg, on the bounce
short again, and Henry pulls it from outside off and times it well enough to beat the deep square leg fielder, who didn't have too far to run to his left

and Milne is dismissed for the first time in international cricket. Down the track, looks to go inside-out over extra cover, and completely misses the ball. His momentum was still taking him down the pitch when the ball reached Sangakkara's gloves. He took his time and removed just one bail, delicately
tossed up outside off. Boult stretches out and pokes it into the covers
flighted again and he drives it down to long-off
on the pads, and he looks to whip it into the leg side, doesn't really get too much bat on it, and Sanga runs round to cut it off
on the pads again, clipped away to the left of deep square leg. Decisive running this time, and they complete the second confidently
down the track now, driven to long-on
full outside off, driven hard but straight to mid-off
full-toss outside off, he swishes at it and slices it in the air, drops down between sweeper cover, running in from the boundary, and short extra cover, running back towards the 30-yard circle
another lofted drive over cover, this time better controlled, and sweeper cover runs to his right to cut it off
length ball outside off, Henry has a swing and a miss
full outside off, and he flat-bats that very hard down the ground. Mahela had been moved back to long-off, and he ended up falling over the ball in an effort to stop it
yorker outside off, he shuffles across and flicks it towards square leg
looks to pull a slow back of a length ball, it hits him on the midriff
fuller now, swiped away to deep backward square leg
down the track, clips this straight to short midwicket
out of his crease again, and this time Senanayake tosses it up wider. Enough room for Boult to swing those arms and mow that over the midwicket boundary
and again! This was straighter, and he came down the track and slog-swept that on one knee

and that is that. Sees him coming down the track again and bowls it wider and pulls his length back a bit. Goes through with the shot anyway and holes out at long-on. Could be a crucial little contribution from Boult.

inn2.comm: shortish and a shade outside off, Dimuth taps it into the off side
excellently done. Not that he had to do much, mind you. Boult strays in line and Dimuth picks it off his hips and trusts his timing to fetch his and his team's first boundary
slanted on the pads again and Dimuth can camp back and tickle it to long leg
fuller delivery, teasing Dilshan outside off and he's not the kind of batsman who'll die wondering. Slashes and misses
almost squares him up with a shorter delivery on and around off stump. Dilshan manages to soften the grip on his bat and keep the outside edge down from slip
on the legs of the right-hander this time and Dilshan helps it along to the long leg boundary, off the thigh pad though
forces Dimuth onto the back foot, but he is good there. Defends into the off side
hits a fuller length on middle and Dimuth turns it towards midwicket
reverts to banging the ball in as Dimuth rises up on his toes to chop the ball into the covers
back of a length and outside off, Dimuth lets it sail by
top shot, that! Also shows off his back-foot strength as he stands up tall behind the back of a length ball and punches it down the ground. Stood and delivered
shortish and a shade outside off, Dimuth guides it into the covers with an open face
stays back and slices a shorti ball square on the off side, but there's no timing on it yet
not enough room for the cut as Dilshan gets the inside edge and the short ball, which rose above his stomach, wanders away behind him
short and wide and Dilshan flays it - straight at point. Guptill does well, running and reaching to his right
goes for a bouncer this time, but it veers a touch down leg and Dilshan is able to hook it down to the long leg boundary. And oops, Matt Henry moves to his left as the ball runs off to his right
punches towards mid-off and sets off for a quick single. And surprise, surprise, Baz fumbles the pick-up
keeps out a back of a length delivery on and around off stump. Looks like New Zealand have decided early that they don't want to bowl full with no swing happening...
gets up tall and slaps a shortish ball outside off through extra cover
gets inside the line of a back of a length delivery and pulls on one-leg to the man behind square on the leg side boundary

oof! cuts him in half with a length ball that rears up to have the forward-pressing Dilshan in severe trouble. Gets an inside edge and Ronchi flings himself to his left and gets a hand to it. Very hard to call that a drop!
full on middle and Dilshan unveils a solid straight drive, which Henry manages to stop with a handy right foot
huge appeal for leg before as Henry gets the ball to skid in at Dilshan again. The batsman was playing around the fuller length delivery, looking to play too square. But that would have missed leg
nudges a shortish delivery to the right of point and retains strike
fuller and inching into the pads again, Dilshan clips it to long leg
147 kph, seeks the yorker, but it is directed too far outside off to interest the batsman
148kph, back of a length and in the off-stump corridor this time and Dimuth allows it to pass
full and inviting the drive at 149kph, Dimuth checks his stroke as he pushes into the off side
good length brings Dimuth forward and he drives into the covers to get off strike
150 kph, sent back past the bowler with supreme authority. Moves his balance onto the front foot and times the straight drive
vociferous appeal from the bowler, and the cordon joins in as well. But the sound was bat clipping the top of the back pad as he sought to drive on the up
full and a bit wide of off stump, Dimuth leans forward and drives into the covers
banged in short and he is lucky to get away with a wide down the leg side as Dimuth misses out on a pull

cuts Dimuth in half this time! Gets the back of a length delivery to move back in off the deck and catch the batsman napping. The back and across movement to enable a cut looks quite bad as the ball sneaks under the bat
shortish and outside off, sliced to point
brings him forward this time as the fuller length delivery outside off is pushed to mid-off
jumps up off his toes and clips a back of a length delivery to short midwicket
punches at the shortish ball outside off, but he can't beat mid-off
stays inside the line of a short ball outside off and slices it behind point
pushes into the covers and sets off right away. Brilliant work from Dilshan as he softened his grip and got the skates on before Nathan McCullum's hits the mark on the bowler's end
another lovely punch off the back foot from Dimuth, beats the bowler to secure a single. Might have been the shortish offcutter from Milne
149kph, no stopping that on a small and fast outfield. Milne's pace seems to be quite appetising to Dilshan as he steps forward and drives through the line of a good length ball outside off
short and wide and Dilshan uses the bowler's pace to crack him to the third man boundary. Not all that much room, but he has such good hands
stays in line with a back of a length delivery on off stump and taps it to mid-off
entices the drive and Dimuth obliges with a solid one that beats mid-on and turns him into an usher for the ball
good reply from Henry as he pulls his length back just a touch and has Dimuth uncertain about moving forward or back. Opens the face to find third man, but is beaten
tucked into the midwicket region to get off strike
clipped off his ankles but Milne down at the long-leg boundary dives full length and saves three runs!
foxed again! Probing length in the avenue of apprehension and Dimuth's is apparent as he gropes with an open face
shortish and Dimuth nudges it to square leg
tossed up on off stump, Dilshan was itching to loft him down the ground but checks himself
presses forward, then realises the length has gone shorter and shifts his balance back to flick through square leg
comes forward and turns the flighted ball away to short midwicket
jumps down the track, and gets a bit too close to the pitch, can only hit it back at the bowler
short and wide outside off, cracked to point
goes for a sweep against a good length ball on leg stump, cramped for room though and can't beat short fine leg
silly mid-off has been placed in an attempt to stop those thumping straight drives and he gets into the mix straight away
back of a length on off stump, Dimuth presents the full face again
full on off stump, Dimuth pushes to mid-off. No single with Baz on it
drives from the crease, but doesn't quite time it. Finds Vettori at mid-on
neatly done. Stands up tall behind the shortish ball and whips it to the left of Vettori at mid-on. Two on offer and two taken easily
gets the drive he was trying to lure from the batsman, and it went uppishly too. Silly mid-off would have been interested for a moment, before realising it was well wide of him
quick single brings up Sri Lanka's fifty and for all the yells of "keeper" in the ground, Dimuth makes it easily. Dilshan ran down to tap the ball to mid-off and knew he wanted a run immediately
eased down the ground to long-on as the openers continue rotating strike
goes deep in the crease and tries to to force the ball into the leg side, but can't beat the bowler
down the track, but McCullum pulls his length back and forces Dilshan to block
goes back, moves leg side of the ball as well and slices it in front of point
flighted on leg stump, Dimuth picks out short midwicket
emphatic straight drive! Boult searches for swing with a fuller length on off stump, but the full face answers and how
eager to get on the front foot is Dilshan, but this time he mistimes a length ball to mid-off
gets forward to block a good length ball on off stump
trusts the pitch so much that he doesn't mind being lead-footed and working the a shortish ball on off stump across the line to long leg
fuller delivery on middle and leg, Dimuth keeps it out
stays back against a back of a length ball and turns it to long leg
tossed up on off stump, tucked around the corner behind square leg
jumps back and makes his own room against a short ball outside off and all Dilshan had to do was open the face and beat short third man
skips down the track to a length ball on middle and defends
moves back to a flatter, quicker ball on middle. DIlshan manages slide it to the sweeper

up comes the finger and the McCullum gets the breakthrough his brother wanted. Fuller delivery hits middle and skids on to strike Dimuth quite low on the pad, an in his haste to get his bat down, Dimuth was playing around the line of it as well
off the mark straight away as Baz lets a push get through him at cover
back of a length and outside off, Sanga gets an inside edge that dribbles into the cordon
slashes at a wide, length ball outside off and misses it
back of a length on off stump, nudged towards midwicket
solid defence against a good length ball on off stump
beautiful slice to point, good enough for a few thousand runs, ends up for nothing
cuts back in at Sanga quite sharply, enough to have Sanga late on his flick. Mild appeal from Boult, but it would have slipped down leg
gets down the track and drives to mid-off. Single on, single taken
down the track to defend a good length ball on middle and leg
nimble footwork nearly gets him to the pitch of the ball as he pushes to mid-on
stays put this time and pushes the good length ball into the covers
ooh! That's an outside edge! But it loops a few yards away from slip. Turn for McCullum had an advancing Sanga in some trouble there
not this time as Sanga runs at the bowler and deposits him into the grass banks beyond long-off
full on middle and leg, ticked away to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover.
deft little slice hits the gap behind point and it's been timed well enough to fetch him two as Boult keeps hitting the deck hard
good length ball on middle, kept out safely
fuller ball a shade outside off, Sanga presents the full face and finds short cover
shortish on middle and leg, Sanga tucks it to one of the two short midwickets
drags his length short and Dilshan has pulled it mightily to deep square leg
waits on another short ball, then rocks back and cuts to deep point
flighted on off stump and Dilshan is down to meet it. Driven to the right of mid-off for a single
"catch," was the call but Sanga had worked out there was no one in close to worry about a top-edged sweep.
stays back and punches a good length ball to long-on
goes back and punches a flatter ball down to long-on and that will be drinks Just forget about drinks, people
good length ball gains some sharp swing off the pitch to rap Sanga on the front pad. Looked quite dangerous for him, having not moved far enough forward. But the umpire says no
down the track and lofts a length ball right over the bowler's head. What a shot
back of a length on off stump, defended
shortish and outside off, sliced to point
full on middle and leg, Sanga waits for it and uses his wrists to send it away to deep square leg
well flighted on middle and leg, swept quite solidly to deep square leg
Danny V on the square boundary is getting a huge workout as Dilshan backs away and cuts a short ball outside off
nudges another shortish delivery off his hips for a single in front of short fine leg
he is in some mood today! Dances down the track with great purpose and lofts McCullum to the long-off boundary again
moves back and turns the slower, good length ball towards square leg to get off strike
picked away off leg stump to deep square leg
tossed up on middle, defended
stays back to a length ball and forces it to cover
quicker delivery, it's the arm ball, but Dilshan is able enough behind it
a lot slower this time as Dilshan presents a full face down on a flighted ball on off stump
goes back and drills a shortish delivery down the ground, but Vettori dives to his right and keeps it to nothing
flighted on off stump, defended  And we have absolute and irrefutable confirmation that it is, in fact, drinks
starts with a short ball, Sangakkara is through his pull a little too early and the ball hits him in the stomach
back of a length on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
146kph, tries to open the face and slice the shortish ball outside off through point, but mistimes it
wants a single after a tap in front of point, but there is none on offer

banged in short and Sanga has to drag it from outside off, and this one had soared over his head as well. Not surprising then that he didn't control the pull but it lands safely in front of deep midwicket
short, wide, four written all over the cut shot until Vettori flung himself to his right on the backward point boundary
good length ball, but he had directed it on leg stump. Sanga exploits it with a cheeky little leg glance
pushes a length ball on the stumps to mid-on
runs at a flighted Vettori delivery and slogs him to deep midwicket
down the track with a push to cover and Baz tumbles to his left to stop it and flick it back at the bowler in one single motion
turned away to short fine leg for an easy single
flatter delivery on middle, Sanga uses his wrists to pick it through midwicket to raise the fifty partnership
a bit short and wide, Sanga fails to pierce the gap at point
145kph, solidly behind a shortish delivery on off stump
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket. The timing was rather good even with Sanga almost falling over the shot
banged in short on middle, Dilshan leaps up off his feet and tucks it through midwicket to secure a well-composed fifty. The impetus he gave at the start of the innings was very vital

in the air.... and Sanga has picked out deep square leg! Short ball on middle, comes at the batsman with a bit too much heat for the pull shot. Latham runs in and dives forward to complete a potentially important catch.
back of a length and outside off, Mahela opens the face to find gully
oh, almost! Vettori saw the batsman advancing and flattened the trajectory and drifted the ball in at Dilshan. The ball is cramped in between bat and pad and it nearly rolls onto the stumps
gets down the track and drives to long-on
flighted on middle and off, defended capably
jumps down the track and attempts a flick across the line. Wears it on the pad, but he was far enough down the pitch
stays back to block this good length ball on middle
"No, no, no!" says Vettori as he watches the latest of late cuts skim away to the third man boundary. Beautiful hands from Mahela

goes wide of the crease, but it doesn't make a shred of difference. Scorching straight drive on the up from Dilshan, but it could have been such a different story too considering Milne had got a hand to it and the deflection nearly hit leg stump
banged in short and Dilshan swivels on the back foot and the pull has enough power behind it to race to the long leg boundary
shortish on middle and leg, it's the cross-seamer from Milne and Dilshan is disconcerted by the extra bounce. Inside edge onto thigh pad as he tries a flick
another pull, same result! Sri Lanka rattling along in the chase and their shots against the seamers have been quite a treat. They haven't held back at all.
shortish and outside off, Dilshan wants to flay it over the covers but has to settle for a bottom edge to point
fuller delivery outside off at 146kph, Dilshan was into the off drive a bit too early and has to pull his bottom hand off. The ball runs down to mid-on
flighted on middle, Mahela blocks
lifts him over cover and needn't have bothered running. Came forward with respect to the flight of the ball and caressed the ball over Baz
flighted on off stump, eased through the covers this time
down the track, but Vettori has slid the tossed up ball in at the batsman's legs to cramp him. Inside edge to mid-on
stays back to a shorter, flatter delivery outside off and slices to point
good length ball on middle and off, kept out
might have been the cutter there as Mahela is into the flick too early, and the back of a length ball kicks up at him and lobs uppishly towards fine leg
inside edge, but it was headed quite safely behind the stumps. Indeed, Dilshan posed the most danger to himself as he sought to tap the ball away and nearly trod on the stumps
back of a length on off stump, defended
fuller ball and Dilshan wants to slam it through the offside, mistimes it to short cover instead
good length ball on off stump, punched down the ground
stays back to a flatter ball on off stump and steers it to point
slower through the air as he tosses it up on off stump, defended
uses his hands to adjust to a good length ball that skids into him, flicked through square leg
down the track, and he ensures he has enough room to drive the length ball to long-off
short and wide, you don't see that too often from Vettori, and Mahela knows as much too. Takes full advantage with a dab behind point
looped in on the pads and Mahela glances it to short fine leg
back of a length and outside off, slapped to point
a little bit of nip back in at Dilshan, but he is able to use that to flick the good length ball square on the leg side

he's bisected a fly slip and the keeper with perfect precision! It's as if he took out a sheet of paper and calculated the angles before picking the bat back up and opening the face just at the right time
good length on middle, flicked to square leg
comes forward and drills a length delivery to mid-off
full delivery curls back in at Dilshan, who is unable to connect with a flick and is rapped on the pads. Would have slid down leg though
flighted on middle and leg, Mahela goes for a flick but he has not judged the slower pace on this properly
moves outside off to sweep a good length ball to short fine leg
flighted on off stump, driven calmly to long-off
jumps down the track and drives through a diving short cover
grip and turn off the pitch as Vettori beats Mahela in the flight. Tame defensive push nearly popped up, but there were no on in close
gets a bit more bounce again, but Mahela does better to defend this
vicious pull off a rank short ball on middle, but there is protection at deep square leg
shortish and outside off, Mahela steers it to deep point
back of a length on off stump, defended
fuller delivery with a hint of movement back in at Dilshan, but it still doesn't deter him from driving on the up to short cover
short and wide and Mahela has crashed it through point. Seems like he has eyes only for the gaps in the field
opens the face and runs a shortish delivery towards third man
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked towards short midwicket
back of a length - it's the slower ball - on off stump, Mahela has spotted it and runs it down to third man
shortish and a shade outside off, and again it's only 124 kph, Dilshan is able to work it through midwicket again
back of a length on off stump, solidly behind it

he managed a four before, but this time he's picked out the fly slip! Scenes that would not have been out of place at a training session as Mahela opens the face against a short ball and picks Taylor at slip
good length ball on middle, turned to short midwicket
shortish and a shade outside off, Dilshan slices it to point
short and wide, Dilshan would have anticipated a boundary off it but Guptill dives to his right and keeps it to nothing. Brilliant work!
drilled down the ground, and again Baz leaps to his right to stop a potential boundary
serenely driven! Not quite overpitched, but Mathews trusts the pitch as he comes forward and caresses the ball
he's forced to leap off his feet this time as the ball is short and it's clipped to long leg
full and outside off, Dilshan slices it to point and Guptill picks up the bump ball and teases the crowd by throwing the ball up in the air
shortish on middle and leg, tucked towards straight midwicket
thought about the pull, but decided against it as he lets the short ball go outside off
fuller delivery on off stump, kept out and Mathews holds his ground as Henry feigns to throw the stumps down
goes wide of the crease in the attempt for a yorker, but it becomes an overpitched delivery which is flicked to deep midwicket
full and speared in, picked off his legs to deep square leg
good length ball outside off, driven on the up into the covers
shortish and outside off, the cut shot ends up behind the stumps as he bottom-edges it
full on off stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length on off stump, tucked towards mid-on
shortish on leg stump and it's been clipped smartly to long leg, and Dilshan has seen it is Vettori there, so he steals a second
another short ball, and Dilshan's timing seems to have faded for the moment. Mistimes the pull again
spoke too soon! Dilshan belts a short ball to the midwicket boundary with an authoritative pull. Boult and one-day cricket continue to be at odds
phew! Hello, Matt Henry. My name is Angelo Mathews and I am going to slap you to the midwicket boundary. And I'll come down the track as well having picked your change of pace
another short ball on off stump, Mathews jumps back into his crease and blocks
back of a length on off stump, defended
another slower ball, this one full and outside off, Mathews thumps it to mid-off
goes short and Mathews realises it's gained a bit too much height to go hard at it. So he guides it with a swivel pull to deep midwicket
short and a shade wide, Dilshan runs it to point
shortish on leg stump, worked away to long leg
stays beside the short delivery and slaps it behind point
stands up tall behind the shortish delivery, punches it down the ground and immediately sets off. Excellently judged single as he bisects mid-on and mid-off
fuller offcutter, pushed to mid-off and Dilshan opts for a single as well. Baz produces a direct hit, but the batsman has reached safety quite easily
banged into the middle of the deck at 136kph and beats Mathews on the hook
good length ball on middle, clipped to deep square leg
and he produces a beauty first ball! Hits a lovely length, where Mathews can't come forward or jump back, and then gets the ball to rip past the outside edge of the tame defensive push
pushed into the covers
stays back this time as he judges the length a bit quicker and nudges to midwicket. Steals a single as well, Sri Lanka have been brilliant at that today
slaps a slider on middle and leg to deep point
flighted on off stump, driven calmly towards mid-off

Boult takes a stunner, but he is too close to the long-off boundary and steps on the rope! Terrific effort from the fast bowler, but he isn't able to get rid of the ball quickly enough. Mathews backed away and foiled Vettori's hopes of cramping him up and his timing was emphatic
shortish delivery outside off, goes for the cut and is beaten
fuller delivery on off stump, driven into the covers
banged in short and Dilshan has swatted it away to deep square leg
tucked away through square leg after he moves back to a shortish ball on middle
moves around the wicket and delivers length, Dilshan accepts gleefully as he slams it through the covers to bring up Sri Lanka's 200. Nearly there
fuller delivery on off stump, Dilshan pushes it to the left of mid-off and secures a single. He's been out there all day and he is still running his shoes into shreds
stays back against a flatter, fuller delivery and taps it to extra cover
tossed up on middle and leg, Dilshan advances to meet it at its pitch and pushes it back at the bowler
a touch short and that allows Dilshan to back away and slice to the sweeper
flighted on middle and leg, turned to short midiwcket
seeks to drill the flighted ball down the ground, but Mathews can't beat the bowler
short and wide, this time and Mathews' cut short finds the fielder. That's drinks
good length ball outside off, Dilshan flashes and misses
shortish and outside off, chopped to point

whoa! No problems with that as Dilshan roars into the nineties with a belt over the covers. It was length, it was just the right pace and it was bowled to a batsman who has controlled this chase brilliantly
good length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
good length ball on off stump, Dilshan pushes it back at the bowler
Even better! This wasn't a bad ball, but Dilshan made it so as he stepped forward, opened the face to place it wide of Vettori and caressed the ball all along the ground
slips a tossed up delivery a few yards down leg and Ronchi has too much to do. Fumbles it and gives an extra in addition to the wide
gets down the track and drives the flighted ball to long-on
down the track and is struck on the front pad right in front of middle. Makes Vettori try an appeal, but he was way too far down the track to be given
turned away through square leg
driven calmly to long-off as he keeps ticking along to that hundred
flighted on off stump, turned towards short midwicket
good length ball, punched to mid-on. No single this time

there it is. His 19th ODI hundred, 10th while chasing a total. Leaps up, punches the air and looks up at the heavens as he creams a length ball right through short cover. Amazing power. And Hamilton roars "Dilshan, Dilshan!"
lands the perfect yorker at 147 kph, but Dilshan keeps it out
146kph, full toss on middle and leg, whipped to deep square leg
a charming whirl of his wrists sends a fuller ball screaming away from off stump to deep midwicket
shortish on off stump, defended carefully as he leaps off his feet against a 149 kph delivery
down the track to reach the ball on the full and drive to long-off
good length ball, pushed towards extra cover and Baz dives to his right to keep it to nothing
stands up tall and punches the shortish ball to Baz at extra cover again
flighted on middle and leg, kept out
good length ball on off stump, pushed to extra cover
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
the pace of New Zealand's bowlers has done little to deter Dilshan. He's spotted this 140+kph short ball early and pulls it way in front of square
wild slog this time off a length delivery, loses his shape completely as he misses it
that's the slower short ball, picked up and pummeled over the wide long-on boundary. Magnificent striking
full on off stump and this was at 140kph, Dilshan planted his front foot in line with it and walloped it barely over the bowler's head. Time for them to run in with helmets?
they're just having fun out there now. Or Dilshan might be tiring as he slogs at a fuller delivery outside off and gets the outside half of the bat to mid-off
good length on off stump at 143 kph, pushed to mid-off
fuller delivery, slower too, as Mathews recognises it and clips through mdiwicket
fuller and slower delivery on middle and leg, gets an inside edge towards short midwicket

he falls to the short ball after taking Sri Lanka so close! Lots of pace behind this from Henry after two slower balls on the trot and he finds Dilshan slow on the pull. Not often has that happened today, might have been tiring as well. Top edge lobs to the keeper and he walks off to a huge ovation. Top hundred, this
another bouncer to the new batsman and Thirimanne tucks his head under his armpit
back of a length on middle and leg, flicked to long leg
shortish and outside off, whipped to long-on
fuller delivery outside off, Mathews defends into the covers
down the track and smears a good length ball through extra cover. Ranks among the best shots of the day
fuller delivery on middle, Mathews turns it to midwicket
goes short on leg stump and Mathews has helped it on its way to the fine leg boundary. Only two left to get now
low full toss on off stump, tapped to short cover
fuller delivery on middle and leg, Mathews whips but finds mid-on
bouncer again on middle and off, Thirimanne sways away
beautifully done again. Short ball right over middle stump forces Thirimanne to bend out of the way
sprawls down into the pitch on the followthrough after a third accurate short ball in a row. Thirimanne hops up and tucks it behind square leg
drummed to the square leg boundary! Took on the short ball that was rising over his head and pulled it away powerfully to seal Sri Lanka's first win on the tour
